text.p: Stocks extended their spectacular rally into a third day Wednesday, lifting the Dow Jones industrial average within 76 points of its record high as Wall Street bet that the Federal Reserve might not raise interest rates as much as expected, if at all.

Based on early and unofficial data, the Dow was up 46.96 points to close at 7,008.99, one day after soaring 179 points in its second largest daily gain ever. The Dow's record high of 7,085.16 was set March 11.
In the broader market, advancing issues swamped declines 16-9 on heavy volume of 559 million shares on the New York Stock Exchange.
